graph.packing
Class GRASPAddSlvr2Packer1

java.lang.Object
  graph.packing.GRASPAddSlvr2Packer1
public final class GRASPAddSlvr2Packer1
extends java.lang.Object

Implements a fast GRASP algorithm for the 1-packing problem, well-known MWIS combinatorial optimization problems. The algorithm is truly adaptive in that in every GRASP iteration, the cost of each available node is updated to reflect the fact that its "free" neighbors are only those that have not been already de-activated by other nodes that have entered the current partial solution. The actual cost of a node at any point is the node's number of free neighbors over the node's weight (the latter doesn't change). Nodes with least cost are selected first. Allows for Local-Search algorithms to kick-in after a solution has been constructed, via the invocation of the AdditiveSolver2 algorithm, as follows: once a solution has been constructed, a number of the first nodes that entered the solution is removed, and then the remaining problem is solved as a Binary Integer Programming problem with the help of Balas' Additive Algorithm. Notice that the methods of this class access the relevant graph's nodes and data structures in an unsynchronized manner for better performance, and are therefore not thread-safe in the face of concurrent modifications to the underlying graph object.

Title: popt4jlib

Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011-2017

Ioannis T. Christou

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws ParallelException
invoke as java -cp <classpath> graph.packing.GRASPAddSlvr2Packer1 <graph_file> [numinitnodes(0)] [numiterations(1)] [do_local_search(false)] [dls_num_threads(1)] [numnodestoremove(10)] [max_allowed_time(ms)(+Inf)] . The graph_file contains the graph in the format specified in the comments of method utils.DataMgr.readGraphFromFile2(filename) and the numinitnodes is an optional number specifying how many (non- conflicting) nodes to choose randomly as an initial seed-set to grow from (default is zero). The solution found is written in the file "sol.out" in the current directory. It contains one line for each node included in the solution, and the line has the internal id of the node +1 (so the range of nodes is [1,...Graph.getNumNodes()].

Parameters:
args - String[] are as follows:
  • args[0] graph_file_name mandatory, the name of the file containing the graph
  • args[1] numinitnodes optional, if present describes the cardinality of an initial random population from which to attempt to construct a first partial solution. Default is 0. Notice that if local-search is enabled, then after an initial maximal solution is constructed, all the numinitnodes that first entered the solution are removed from the solution before the local search phase starts.
  • args[2] numiterations optional, if present describes the number of major outer iterations to run. Default is 1.
  • args[3] do_local_search optional, if "true" implies a local search via the popt4jlib.LIP.AdditiveSolver2 algorithm to be performed after solution is constructed in a major outer iteration. Default is false.
  • args[4] num_dls_threads optional, if present describes the number of threads to use in the AdditiveSolver2 procedure if activated. Default is 1.
  • args[5] numnodestoremove optional, if present describes the number of nodes to remove from a packing solution, before the ADDITIVE Algorithm kicks in. Default is 10. This number is in addition to any initnumnodes that would be removed if such a number was specified in the command line. Also notice that the numnodestoremove are the ones with lightest weight in the current solution (ties broken with heaviest neighbors weight).
  • args[6] max_allowed_time optional, if present, sets the max. allowed time for the process to run (in milliseconds). Default is +infinity.
Throws:
ParallelException
